subject: Science
title: Climate vs. Weather
description: A short lesson to help you apply Climate vs. Weather.

hook.text: When it snows in winter, someone always says 'so much for global warming.' They're confused.

buildup.text: Weather is what happens today. Climate is the average over 30 years or more.

discovery.text: A single cold day says nothing about climate. Trends over decades do.

twist.text: Climate change actually makes some winters worse â€” warmer air holds more moisture for snow.

climax.text: The distinction matters because policy depends on understanding long-term trends.

punchline.text: Weather is your mood. Climate is your personality. Don't confuse them.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between weather and climate?
options: Weather is short-term; climate is a long-term average
Weather is local; climate is global
Weather is natural; climate is man-made
